pull.title: [qt] CoinControlDialog amount header display unit
pull.body: The coin control table currently only says "Amount". This makes it more consistent with other tables by showing the current display unit like "Amount (BTC)".

events.message:
[qt] CoinControlDialog header amount display unit
The current display unit will now be appended to the amount header as in other tables.

[qt] CoinControlDialog adjusted column widths
Made amount column wider to make sure the display unit fits.
Also decreased the width of the label column to get the same total width.

events.body: 20px is just enough to fit the widest unit "Amount (mBTC)" on Ubuntu. But I'm not sure if there is some case where it doesn't fit, since different operating systems or window managers seem to have different font sizes.

<!--5d09a71f8925f3f132321140b44b946d-->The last travis run for this pull request was 279 days ago and is thus outdated. To trigger a fresh travis build, this pull request should be closed and re-opened.
Closing as "Up for grabs". Also looks like the author is no longer active on GitHub.

comments.body: Why the extra roundtrip via `UpdateAmountHeader()` instead of just setting the header item here? Could use a comment to make it more obvious whats happening here.
Maybe I could rename it to something like `UpdateAmountDisplayUnit()`? I realize that `UpdateAmountHeader()` is kind of vague.
Agree with @jonasschnelli: just setting the header will do.
